title: Finding Your First Main
body:
I was talking to Riot Neon about how I got into League, and she asked me to share my story.

I played one game of League of Legends in beta as Karthus, and I absolutely hated the game because it seemed really strange that my autoattacks were super slow, and I had to constantly spam Q to get damage off. 

I came back a month before the first season started, and the very first champion I played was Akali because she was free that week. The first three games I played I ended up with about 30 kills a game and had close to 90 kills after 3 games. I loved that she was a snowbally assassin that felt really rewarding to kill other players with and stuck with her as my most played champ that week. 

I spent a lot of time using her to level up to 30, before I eventually switched into playing Katarina, another reset champion. 

I remember returning to Akali after not playing her for a long time during my first tournament at IPL3. I spent maybe less than a week practicing her, and we had to use a substitute mid laner, so I had to play top lane Akali which was very far from my comfort role. I played against Hotshotgg's Galio top lane and killed him solo while he tried to TP away and won the series and the tournament. 

Looking back, it's been a while since i've played her. She's been relatively low priority as one of my picks, but I know one day she'll be back as one of the champions I enjoy playing mainly because her kit is really fun for me to use.

So how about you? How did you find your first main?

replies.body: Mine was Nami! I fell in love with her when she first came out. Mostly because she is a mermaid, but also because of her kit. She wasn't as powerful as other supports when she first came out, so people weren't always very happy when I picked her. I remember my excitement when she was picked in LCS. Also, when I found out she was getting buffed a few months ago. I was like, see! The power of the mermaid has manifested! #OGNamilover

Oh man, when I saw this topic the first thing I did was search for Nami!

When I first started playing just last year, I had basically no idea what I was doing, and this was just on the cusp of s4 with the support items coming out so no one in my group of friends either played or wanted to play support. That was my role every game and nothing made me happier than picking up a champion with a kit I love top to bottom and that no one else was playing.

Playing her on free week was like having my eyes opened to all of the cool things that a support can do. She had slows, she had heals, she had damage, she could kite, she could really just do it all. Coming off of the pre-meta Annie support with her point and click stun, I can still remember the first time I landed a bubble to stop a gank which we turned into a kill. I just sort of sat back and thought to myself, "I made that happen," and it was the first time I really contributed to a game based on something that I needed skill to do.

I've played about 900 games since I picked her up, and probably 85% of those are just on Nami. Best Fish World.

I love Nami too! She was my first support, and now I'm a support main. I remember friends trying to get me to try support, and I was like, "No way. I don't player healers in games." When I finally tried her and realized her powerful and aggressive her kit was, she actually ended up becoming my new main (and new role!).  I think I had one ranked season where I *only* played Nami.

One thing I've noticed (and love!) is how many Nami mains there are, and how fiercely loyal and in love we are with her.

When I first started playing, I started researching champions I think I'd like to play, and immediately fell in love with the idea of Riven. I loved her aesthetic, her attitude, her story, and her kit. I told my friends I would wait until I was better at the game to buy her, and diligently tried to improve by playing whatever was free that week instead.

Around level 10, I logged on one day to receive a gift from a friend: Riven! I was so touched that a friend I had never met in person and only played LoL with got me the champion I had been lusting after. For the next 10 or so levels, I played literally nothing but Riven*. To this day, I get super happy when I see Riven (except when the enemy team plays her, ugh). I even met the friend who bought me Riven at PAX Prime last year!

*Disclaimer: I was probably the worst Riven NA.

Your Riven is *AMAZING!*

The first champion I mained was Caitlyn. 

I spent a lot of time watching my friends play the game but didn't have a computer to play it myself. The game was so interesting and I liked so many of the characters and the overall dynamic of the game so I ended up using my up and coming tax return to purchase a half decent laptop so I could play too. A bit before that, my friends were looking at the next new champion coming out, explaining to me how they put out new characters to play every two weeks (BACK IN MY DAY). That's when I saw her. My beautiful steam-punk princess. The second my laptop arrived I downloaded League, went to GameStop, bought a ten dollar RP card, and bought Caitlyn right when I got home. 

Looking back, I didn't realize what a monster I was. I would play Caitlyn mid. Only. I would take ghost/tp for summoners and run/tp all over the map trying to kill anything and everything. I started trap level one and would line their side of the river with three traps so it made it harder for them to CS without stepping in one and taking a head-shot to the face.

I was the worst kind of person.

I don't really play ADC anymore, and it's actually my least favorite roll now, but Caitlyn still holds a place in my heart for being the entire reason I wanted to start playing League in the first place.

My friend finally convinced me to play League near the end of season 2. He thought I would do well as an ADC but I just didn't get the mechanics, I was constantly focused on my abilities. After 10 games or so, I tried Katarina and had a blast, but still was no good. Around level 15 I tried Ezreal purely for his ult, but found immediately that I enjoyed all of his skill shots a ton. Soon enough I was experimenting with him in the mid lane, and ever since I haven't found anything that can quite compare to his versatile builds and skillshot play style. Even when he's out of meta, I can always find success and a ton of fun with the man with the best dance in the league. And anyone who disagrees belongs in a museum.

Taric was also my first main. None of the Tutorial champions (Ryze, Ashe, Garen) felt "fun" to me, as I was new to League and didn't understand most of the abilities. When I played my first real game, I got to choose from the weekly free champions, and Taric "The Gem Knight" caught my eye. Having played a Paladin in WoW for years, I knew it was a style I liked. And his kit was simple: Heal, Armor Aura, and Stun. It took me a while longer to understand the rest of the game, but Taric was the champion that kept me coming back to play more. Not sure where I would be had he not been free that particular week.

He's still my favorite support, and not that bad in solo queue, though I don't main him anymore.

I started playing sometime in season 1, and back then I was a major Guild Wars player.  I main character on there was a Warrior I played as a pure tank.  Even though that game had the regular MMO trinity I sacrificed what little offense I could have had so that I didn't need to be healed particularly often.  It got to the point that my guild's healer started bringing damage.

The first champion I played in League was Cho'Gath, because he looked cool, and I didn't really understand how the game was supposed to work.  After that match I went and played the tutorial, and one of the avaliable champions in it had a defensive ability and a passive that healed him.  I tried him out, and he just clicked with the mindset I had built up from past games.  I've been a Garen main ever since, and I have no intention of ever changing.

It's really funny, but I feel like I'm constantly finding my new main :).

Right now, I'm spamming the hell out of Graves in ranked, while I'm trying to learn Corki and Kalista (I just switched to an ADC main from Jungle main). 

When I was jungling, I *loved* playing Udyr though. The first time I kited an entire team across the map with just a sliver of health, I fondly recall shouting at the monitor, "YOU CANNOT STOP MANBEARPIG!" and laughing my ass off the entire time.

Good times ;).
